original: 'di ni de bzhin nyid la gnas shing sems med pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: 'di ni de bzhin nyid la gnas shing sems med pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: This is the samādhi called abiding in suchness and being free of mind.

original: de la lus kyi skyon yang dag par sel ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la lus kyi skyon yang dag par sel ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the samādhi called the elimination of the faults of the body?

original: ting nge 'dzin gang la gnas shing ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi lus mi dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gang la gnas shing ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi lus mi dmigs pa ste /
translated: It is the samādhi standing in which they do not apprehend the body of any samādhi.

original: 'di ni lus kyi skyon yang dag par sel ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: 'di ni lus kyi skyon yang dag par sel ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: This is the samādhi called the elimination of the faults of the body.

original: de la ngag gi skyon rnam par 'jig pas nam mkha' ltar gyur pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la ngag gi skyon rnam par 'jig pas nam mkha' ltar gyur pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the samādhi called the space-like elimination of the faults of speech?

original: ting nge 'dzin gang la gnas shing ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi ngag gi las mi dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gang la gnas shing ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi ngag gi las mi dmigs pa ste /
translated: It is the samādhi in which all verbal actions of all samādhis are non-apprehensible.

original: 'di ni ngag gi skyon rnam par 'jig pas nam mkha' ltar gyur pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: 'di ni ngag gi skyon rnam par 'jig pas nam mkha' ltar gyur pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: This is the samādhi called the space-like destruction of verbal faults.

original: de la nam mkha' ltar chags pa med pas rnam par grol zhing gos pa med pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la nam mkha' ltar chags pa med pas rnam par grol zhing gos pa med pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the samādhi called liberation through space-like non-attachment and non-defilement?

original: ting nge 'dzin gang la gnas shing chos thams cad nam mkha' ltar chags pa med pas rnam par grol zhing gos pa med pa 'thob pa ste /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gang la gnas shing chos thams cad nam mkha' ltar chags pa med pas rnam par grol zhing gos pa med pa 'thob pa ste /
translated: It is the samādhi in which all phenomena are liberated through space-like non-attachment and non-defilement.

original: 'di ni nam mkha' ltar chags pa med pas rnam par grol zhing gos pa med pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: 'di ni nam mkha' ltar chags pa med pas rnam par grol zhing gos pa med pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: This is the samādhi called liberation through space-like non-attachment and non-defilement.

original: rab 'byor 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i theg pa chen po'o zhes bya ba ni bsod nams kyi tshogs so //
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i theg pa chen po'o zhes bya ba ni bsod nams kyi tshogs so //
translated: This, Subhūti, is the Great Vehicle of the bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom.”

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i theg pa chen po ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i theg pa chen po ni 'di lta ste /
translated: “Furthermore, Subhūti, the Great Vehicle of the bodhisattva great beings is as follows:

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi ste /
translated: the four establishments of mindfulness.

original: bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four?

original: lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / tshor ba dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / sems dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / tshor ba dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / sems dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'o //
translated: The establishment of mindfulness on the body, the establishment of mindfulness on feeling, the establishment of mindfulness on mind, and the establishment of mindfulness on phenomena.

original: de la lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the establishment of mindfulness on the body?

original: rab 'byor 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po brtun pa dang ldan pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po brtun pa dang ldan pa /
translated: Subhūti, here the bodhisattva great beings, being diligent,

original: dran @226a * //🔽pa dang ldan pa /
analyzed: dran @226a * //🔽pa dang ldan pa /
translated: mindful,

original: shes bzhin can dran pa dang ldan pas 'jig rten la chags sems dang yid mi bde ba rnam par bsal nas nang gi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing de yang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas te /
analyzed: shes bzhin can dran pa dang ldan pas 'jig rten la chags sems dang yid mi bde ba rnam par bsal nas nang gi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing de yang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas te /
translated: Being mindful and fully aware, he dwells in equanimity, having removed both satisfaction and dissatisfaction.

original: lus dang ldan pa'i rnam par rtog pa la rnam par mi rtog go //
analyzed: lus dang ldan pa'i rnam par rtog pa la rnam par mi rtog go //
translated: He does not conceptualize the concepts associated with the body.

original: phyi'i lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing de yang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas te /
analyzed: phyi'i lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing de yang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas te /
translated: He dwells in equanimity, having removed both satisfaction and dissatisfaction.

original: lus dang ldan pa'i rnam par rtog pa la rnam par mi rtog go //
analyzed: lus dang ldan pa'i rnam par rtog pa la rnam par mi rtog go //
translated: He does not conceptualize the concepts associated with the body.

original: phyi nang gi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing de yang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas te /
analyzed: phyi nang gi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing de yang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas te /
translated: He dwells in equanimity, having removed both satisfaction and dissatisfaction.

original: lus dang ldan pa'i rnam par rtog pa la rnam par mi rtog go /
analyzed: lus dang ldan pa'i rnam par rtog pa la rnam par mi rtog go /
translated: He does not conceptualize the concepts associated with the body.

original: de bzhin du nang gi tshor ba dang sems dang chos la chos kyi rjes su lta zhing de yang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas te chos dang ldan pa'i rnam par rtog pa la rnam par mi rtog go //
analyzed: de bzhin du nang gi tshor ba dang sems dang chos la chos kyi rjes su lta zhing de yang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas te chos dang ldan pa'i rnam par rtog pa la rnam par mi rtog go //
translated: In the same way, he dwells contemplating the internal feelings, mind, and dharmas as dharmas, and he dwells contemplating the external feelings, mind, and dharmas as dharmas, and he dwells contemplating the internal and external feelings, mind, and dharmas as dharmas, but without taking anything as a basis.

original: phyi'i tshor ba dang sems dang chos la chos kyi rjes su lta zhing de yang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas te chos dang ldan pa'i rnam par rtog pa la rnam par mi rtog go //🔽phyi nang gi tshor ba dang sems dang chos la chos kyi rjes su lta zhing de yang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas te /
analyzed: phyi'i tshor ba dang sems dang chos la chos kyi rjes su lta zhing de yang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas te chos dang ldan pa'i rnam par rtog pa la rnam par mi rtog go // phyi nang gi tshor ba dang sems dang chos la chos kyi rjes su lta zhing de yang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas te /
translated: He dwells contemplating the arising of the internal feelings, mind, and dharmas as dharmas, and he dwells contemplating the arising of the external feelings, mind, and dharmas as dharmas, and he dwells contemplating the arising of the internal and external feelings, mind, and dharmas as dharmas, but without taking anything as a basis.🔽He dwells contemplating the cessation of the internal feelings, mind, and dharmas as dharmas, and he dwells contemplating the cessation of the external feelings, mind, and dharmas as dharmas, and he dwells contemplating the cessation of the internal and external feelings, mind, and dharmas as dharmas, but without taking anything as a basis.

original: chos dang ldan pa'i rnam par rtog pa la rnam par mi rtog go //
analyzed: chos dang ldan pa'i rnam par rtog pa la rnam par mi rtog go //
translated: He dwells contemplating the enjoyment and enjoyment-abandonment of the internal feelings, mind, and dharmas as dharmas, and he dwells contemplating the enjoyment and enjoyment-abandonment of the external feelings, mind, and dharmas as dharmas, and he dwells contemplating the enjoyment and enjoyment-abandonment of the internal and external feelings, mind, and dharmas as dharmas, but without taking anything as a basis.

original: rab 'byor ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po nang gi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas she na /
analyzed: rab 'byor ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po nang gi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas she na /
translated: “Subhūti, how do bodhisattva great beings dwell watching the body as body?

original: rab 'byor 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'gro na 'gro'o zhes bya bar rab tu shes so //🔽'greng na 'greng ngo zhes bya bar rab tu shes so //
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'gro na 'gro'o zhes bya bar rab tu shes so // 'greng na 'greng ngo zhes bya bar rab tu shes so //
translated: Subhūti, here a bodhisattva mahāsattva, when going, knows “I am going.”🔽When standing, he knows “I am standing.”

original: 'dug na 'dug go zhes bya bar rab tu shes so //
analyzed: 'dug na 'dug go zhes bya bar rab tu shes so //
translated: When sitting, he knows “I am sitting.”

original: nyal na nyal lo zhes bya bar rab tu shes so //
analyzed: nyal na nyal lo zhes bya bar rab tu shes so //
translated: When lying down, he knows “I am lying down.”

original: lus de gya nom pa'am gya nom pa ma yin par gnas pa de lta de ltar rab tu shes so //
analyzed: lus de gya nom pa'am gya nom pa ma yin par gnas pa de lta de ltar rab tu shes so //
translated: He knows in whatever way that body is situated, whether well or not well.

original: rab 'byor de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po brtun pa dang ldan pa shes bzhin can dran pa dang ldan pa 'jig rten la chags sems dang yid mi bde ba rnam par bsal nas nang gi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing de
analyzed: rab 'byor de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po brtun pa dang ldan pa shes bzhin can dran pa dang ldan pa 'jig rten la chags sems dang yid mi bde ba rnam par bsal nas nang gi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing de
translated: Subhūti, in that way a bodhisattva mahāsattva endowed with effort, mindfulness, and introspection, having cleared away worldly thoughts and unhappiness, internally looks at the body and dwells observing the body as a body.

original: yang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas te /
analyzed: yang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas te /
translated: He does so without apprehending anything.

original: lus dang ldan pa'i rnam par rtog pa la rnam par mi rtog pa yin no //
analyzed: lus dang ldan pa'i rnam par rtog pa la rnam par mi rtog pa yin no //
translated: He is without conceptualization regarding conceptualizations about the body.

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po nang gi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa ni 'gro 'am ldog kyang shes bzhin du spyod pa @226b yin /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po nang gi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa ni 'gro 'am ldog kyang shes bzhin du spyod pa @226b yin /
translated: Furthermore, Subhūti, when bodhisattva great beings are attending to the body in the body internally, they are practicing with awareness when going or coming,

original: kun tu lta ba'am rnam par lta ba yang shes bzhin du spyod pa yin /🔽bskum pa dang / brkyang ba dang / snam sbyar dang / lhung bzed dang / chos gos thogs pa dang / za ba dang / 'thung ba dang / 'cha' ba dang / nyal ba dang / gnyid kyis non pa bsang ba dang / 'ong ba dang /
analyzed: kun tu lta ba'am rnam par lta ba yang shes bzhin du spyod pa yin / bskum pa dang / brkyang ba dang / snam sbyar dang / lhung bzed dang / chos gos thogs pa dang / za ba dang / 'thung ba dang / 'cha' ba dang / nyal ba dang / gnyid kyis non pa bsang ba dang / 'ong ba dang /
translated: when looking ahead or looking around,

original: 'gro ba dang / 'greng ba dang / 'dug pa dang / nyal ba dang / gnyid kyis log pa dang / sad pa dang / smra ba dang / mi smra ba dang / nang du yang dag par 'jog pa na yang shes bzhin du spyod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'gro ba dang / 'greng ba dang / 'dug pa dang / nyal ba dang / gnyid kyis log pa dang / sad pa dang / smra ba dang / mi smra ba dang / nang du yang dag par 'jog pa na yang shes bzhin du spyod pa yin te /
translated: when bending or stretching, when carrying their Dharma robes, alms bowl, and outer robe, when eating, drinking, consuming, and tasting, when defecating and urinating, when walking, standing, sitting, lying down, falling asleep, waking up, talking, remaining silent, and when resting in equipoise.

original: rab 'byor de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po brtun pa dang / shes bzhin can dran pa dang ldan pas 'jig rten la chags sems dang yid mi bde ba rnam par bsal nas nang gi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas kyang de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis lus dang ldan pa'i rnam par rtog pa la rnam par
analyzed: rab 'byor de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po brtun pa dang / shes bzhin can dran pa dang ldan pas 'jig rten la chags sems dang yid mi bde ba rnam par bsal nas nang gi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas kyang de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis lus dang ldan pa'i rnam par rtog pa la rnam par
translated: In this way, Subhūti, the bodhisattva great being, steadfast, introspective, mindful, having warded off worldly attachment and depression, dwells while watching the body in the body, but he does not conceptualize the body.

original: mi rtog pa yin no //
analyzed: mi rtog pa yin no //
translated: He is nonconceptual.

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dran bzhin du dbugs 'byung na dran bzhin du dbugs 'byung ngo zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dran bzhin du dbugs 'byung na dran bzhin du dbugs 'byung ngo zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
translated: Moreover, Subhūti, when the bodhisattva great being breathes out mindfully, he knows it just as it is: “I am breathing out mindfully.”

original: dran bzhin du dbugs rngubs na dran bzhin du dbugs rngubs so zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
analyzed: dran bzhin du dbugs rngubs na dran bzhin du dbugs rngubs so zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
translated: When he breathes in mindfully, he knows it just as it is: “I am breathing in mindfully.”

original: dbugs ring du 'byung na yang dbugs ring du 'byung ngo zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
analyzed: dbugs ring du 'byung na yang dbugs ring du 'byung ngo zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
translated: When breathing out long, he knows as it really is: I am breathing out long.

original: dbugs ring du rngubs na yang dbugs ring du rngubs so zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //🔽dbugs thung du 'byung na yang dbugs thung du 'byung ngo zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
analyzed: dbugs ring du rngubs na yang dbugs ring du rngubs so zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so // dbugs thung du 'byung na yang dbugs thung du 'byung ngo zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
translated: When breathing in short, he knows as it really is: I am breathing in short.🔽When breathing out short, he knows as it really is: I am breathing out short.🔽When breathing in gross, he knows as it really is: I am breathing in gross.🔽When breathing out gross, he knows as it really is: I am breathing out gross.🔽When breathing in fine, he knows as it really is: I am breathing in fine.

original: dbugs thung du rngubs na yang dbugs thung du rngubs so zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //🔽rab 'byor 'di lta ste /
analyzed: dbugs thung du rngubs na yang dbugs thung du rngubs so zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so // rab 'byor 'di lta ste /
translated: When breathing out fine, he knows as it really is: I am breathing out fine.

original: dper na rdza mkhan nam rdza mkhan gyi mchan bu mkhas pas 'khor lo skor bar byed pa ni ring du bskor ba ring du bskor ro zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
analyzed: dper na rdza mkhan nam rdza mkhan gyi mchan bu mkhas pas 'khor lo skor bar byed pa ni ring du bskor ba ring du bskor ro zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
translated: Subhūti, it is just as when a potter or a potter’s apprentice turns a wheel, he knows as it really is: I am turning a long wheel, long.

original: thung du bskor na thung du bskor ro zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
analyzed: thung du bskor na thung du bskor ro zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
translated: if it is a short exhalation, he knows “it is a short exhalation.”

original: rab 'byor de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni dran bzhin du dbugs 'byung na dran bzhin du dbugs 'byung ngo zhes @227a * //
analyzed: rab 'byor de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni dran bzhin du dbugs 'byung na dran bzhin du dbugs 'byung ngo zhes @227a * //
translated: In the same way, Subhūti, a bodhisattva mahāsattva, when exhaling with mindfulness,

original: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //🔽dran bzhin du dbugs rngubs na dran bzhin du dbugs rngubs so zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //🔽dbugs ring du 'byung na dbugs ring du 'byung ngo zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
analyzed: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so // dran bzhin du dbugs rngubs na dran bzhin du dbugs rngubs so zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so // dbugs ring du 'byung na dbugs ring du 'byung ngo zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
translated: knows it as it really is: “I am exhaling with mindfulness.”🔽When inhaling with mindfulness, he knows it as it really is: “I am inhaling with mindfulness.”🔽When exhaling a long breath, he knows it as it really is: “I am exhaling a long breath.”

original: dbugs thung du 'byung na dbugs thung du 'byung ngo zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
analyzed: dbugs thung du 'byung na dbugs thung du 'byung ngo zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
translated: When inhaling a short breath, he knows it as it really is: “I am inhaling a short breath.”

original: dbugs thung du nang du 'byung na dbugs thung du 'byung ngo zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
analyzed: dbugs thung du nang du 'byung na dbugs thung du 'byung ngo zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
translated: When he breathes out a short breath, he knows “I am breathing out a short breath.”

original: dbugs thung du rngubs na dbugs thung du rngubs so zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
analyzed: dbugs thung du rngubs na dbugs thung du rngubs so zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
translated: When he breathes in a short breath, he knows “I am breathing in a short breath.”

original: rab 'byor de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po brtun pa dang ldan pa shes bzhin can dran pa dang ldan pas 'jig rten la chags sems dang yid mi bde ba rnam par bsal nas /
analyzed: rab 'byor de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po brtun pa dang ldan pa shes bzhin can dran pa dang ldan pas 'jig rten la chags sems dang yid mi bde ba rnam par bsal nas /
translated: In this way, Subhūti, a bodhisattva great being who is energetic, who has established mindfulness, and who is concentrated, having cleared away worldly longing and displeasure,

original: rang gi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas kyang de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis lus dang ldan pa'i rnam par rtog pa la rnam par mi rtog pa yin no //
analyzed: rang gi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas kyang de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis lus dang ldan pa'i rnam par rtog pa la rnam par mi rtog pa yin no //
translated: dwells while watching his own body in the body, but without discriminating the body.

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: “Furthermore, Subhūti, when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom,

original: lus 'di nyid las sa'i khams dang / chu'i khams dang / me'i khams dang / rlung gi khams kyang yod do zhes bya bar khams rnams la so so yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs par byed do //
analyzed: lus 'di nyid las sa'i khams dang / chu'i khams dang / me'i khams dang / rlung gi khams kyang yod do zhes bya bar khams rnams la so so yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs par byed do //
translated: In this very body, there is the earth element, the water element, the fire element, and the wind element.

original: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na /
translated: Subhūti, it is like this:

original: ba lang gi shan pa'am ba lang gi shan pa'i mchan bu mkhas pas mtshon rnon pos ba lang bsad nas cha bzhir byed do //
analyzed: ba lang gi shan pa'am ba lang gi shan pa'i mchan bu mkhas pas mtshon rnon pos ba lang bsad nas cha bzhir byed do //
translated: A butcher or a butcher’s apprentice, having killed a cow, would divide it into four parts.

original: cha bzhir byas nas 'greng ngam 'dug ste de la rab tu rtog pa de bzhin du /

analyzed: mi slob pa'i gang zag dgra bcom pa dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi dad pa'i dbang @232b po dang / brtson 'grus kyi dbang po dang / dran pa'i dbang po dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang po dang / shes rab kyi dbang po gang yin pa ste /
translated: It is the faculty of faith, the faculty of perseverance, the faculty of mindfulness, the faculty of concentration, and the faculty of wisdom of the person who is not a learner, the worthy one, the pratyekabuddha, the bodhisattva, and the tathāgata.

analyzed: rab 'byor 'di ni kun shes pa bsrung ba'i dbang po zhes bya ba ste /

analyzed: rab 'byor 'di yang de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i theg pa chen po'o //
translated: Subhūti, this too is the Great Vehicle of the bodhisattva great beings, and in it they go forth to the knowledge of all aspects.

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i theg pa chen po ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i theg pa chen po ni 'di lta ste /
translated: “Furthermore, Subhūti, the Great Vehicle of the bodhisattva great beings is this:

original: ting nge 'dzin gsum ste /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gsum ste /
translated: the three meditative stabilizations.

original: gsum gang zhe na /
analyzed: gsum gang zhe na /

analyzed: rab 'byor 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'dod pa rnams kyis dben /

original: sdig to mi dge ba'i chos rnams kyis dben /
analyzed: sdig to mi dge ba'i chos rnams kyis dben /
translated: separated from evil and nonvirtuous dharmas,

original: rtog pa dang bcas pa dpyod pa dang bcas pa /
analyzed: rtog pa dang bcas pa dpyod pa dang bcas pa /

analyzed: dben pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba can bsam gtan dang po la nye bar bsgrubs nas gnas pa gang yin pa ste /

original: 'di ni rtog pa dang bcas dpyod pa dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni rtog pa dang bcas dpyod pa dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin zhes bya'o //

original: de la rtog pa med la dpyod pa tsam gyi ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la rtog pa med la dpyod pa tsam gyi ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /

original: bsam gtan dang po dang bsam gtan gnyis pa'i bar gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po dang bsam gtan gnyis pa'i bar gang yin pa ste /
translated: It is the concentration that is between the first and second absorptions.

original: 'di ni rtog pa med la dpyod pa tsam gyi ting nge 'dzin zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni rtog pa med la dpyod pa tsam gyi ting nge 'dzin zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the concentration that is without applied thought but with sustained thought.

original: de la rtog pa med cing dpyod pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la rtog pa med cing dpyod pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /

original: bsam gtan gnyis pa nas 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi bar la snyoms par 'jug pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan gnyis pa nas 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi bar la snyoms par 'jug pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: It is the concentration that is between the second absorption and the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception.

original: 'di ni rtog pa med cing dpyod pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ni rtog pa med cing dpyod pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin zhes bya ste /

translated: Subhūti, this too is the Great Vehicle of the bodhisattva great beings, by way of not apprehending anything.

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i theg pa chen po ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i theg pa chen po ni 'di lta ste /
translated: “Furthermore, Subhūti, the Great Vehicle of the bodhisattva great beings is as follows:

original: rjes su dran pa bcu ste /
analyzed: rjes su dran pa bcu ste /
translated: It is the ten recollections.

original: bcu gang zhe na /
analyzed: bcu gang zhe na /
translated: What are the ten?

original: sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa dang / chos rjes su dran pa dang / dge 'dun rjes su dran pa dang / tshul khrims rjes su dran pa dang / gtong ba rjes su dran pa dang / lha rjes su dran pa dang / skyo ba rjes su dran pa dang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa dang / chos rjes su dran pa dang / dge 'dun rjes su dran pa dang / tshul khrims rjes su dran pa dang / gtong ba rjes su dran pa dang / lha rjes su dran pa dang / skyo ba rjes su dran pa dang /

analyzed: rab 'byor 'di yang de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i theg pa chen po'o //
translated: Subhūti, this also is the Great Vehicle of the bodhisattva great beings, because it is not apprehended.

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i theg pa chen po ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i theg pa chen po ni 'di lta ste /
translated: “Furthermore, Subhūti, the Great Vehicle of the bodhisattva great beings is this:

original: bsam gtan bzhi dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu ste /

analyzed: rab 'byor 'di yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i theg pa chen po yin no //
translated: Subhūti, this too is the Great Vehicle of the bodhisattva great beings.

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i theg pa chen po ni 'di lta ste /

translated: “Furthermore, Subhūti, the Great Vehicle of the bodhisattva great beings is as follows:

original: rab 'byor 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gnas la yang gnas su gnas ma yin pa la yang gnas ma yin par yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pa dang / 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang /

analyzed: sta zhes bya ba ni stong pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o //
translated: “The syllable sta is the gateway of all phenomena because of the non-apprehension of emptiness.

original: dzny'a zhes bya ba ni ye shes dmigs su med pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o //
analyzed: dzny'a zhes bya ba ni ye shes dmigs su med pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o //
translated: Jña is the gateway to all dharmas because of the non-apprehension of wisdom.

original: na zhes bya ba ni gzhan mi dmigs pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o //
analyzed: na zhes bya ba ni gzhan mi dmigs pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o //
translated: Na is the gateway to all dharmas because of the non-apprehension of others.

original: ha zhes bya ba ni rgyu mi dmigs pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o //
analyzed: ha zhes bya ba ni rgyu mi dmigs pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o //
translated: Ha is the gateway to all dharmas because of the non-apprehension of causes.

original: bha zhes bya ba ni 'jig pa med pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o //
analyzed: bha zhes bya ba ni 'jig pa med pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o //
translated: Bha is the gateway to all dharmas because of the absence of destruction.

original: tsha zhes bya ba ni mdog mi dmigs pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o //
analyzed: tsha zhes bya ba ni mdog mi dmigs pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o //
translated: Tsa is the gateway to all dharmas because of the non-apprehension of color.

original: sma zhes bya ba ni dran pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o //🔽hva zhes bya ba ni bad pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o //🔽sa zhes bya ba ni spro pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o//
analyzed: sma zhes bya ba ni dran pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o // hva zhes bya ba ni bad pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o // sa zhes bya ba ni spro pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o//
translated: Sma is the gateway to all dharmas because of the non-apprehension of mindfulness.🔽Hva is the gateway to all dharmas because of the non-apprehension of foam.🔽Sa is the gateway to all dharmas because of the non-apprehension of expansion.

original: gha zhes bya ba ni stug po mi dmigs pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o //
analyzed: gha zhes bya ba ni stug po mi dmigs pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o //
translated: Gha is the gateway to all dharmas because of the non-apprehension of density.

original: tha zhes bya ba ni rnam par bsgrub pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o //
analyzed: tha zhes bya ba ni rnam par bsgrub pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o //
translated: “The syllable tha is the gateway to all phenomena because of the non-apprehension of accomplishment.

original: na zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa dang bral ba'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o //🔽pha zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu mi dmigs pa'i phyir chos @236a * //
analyzed: na zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa dang bral ba'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o // pha zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu mi dmigs pa'i phyir chos @236a * //
translated: “The syllable na is the gateway to all phenomena because of the absence of afflictions.

original: thams cad kyi sgo'o //
analyzed: thams cad kyi sgo'o //
translated: “The syllable pha is the gateway to all phenomena because of the non-apprehension of results.

original: ska zhes bya ba ni phung po mi dmigs pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o //
analyzed: ska zhes bya ba ni phung po mi dmigs pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o //
translated: “The syllable ka is the gateway to all phenomena because of the non-apprehension of the aggregates.

original: dz'a zhes bya ba ni dga' ba mi dmigs pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o //🔽tse zhes bya ba ni spyod pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o //
analyzed: dz'a zhes bya ba ni dga' ba mi dmigs pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o // tse zhes bya ba ni spyod pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o //
translated: “The syllable ja is the gateway to all phenomena because of the non-apprehension of joy.🔽“The syllable ce is the gateway to all phenomena because of the non-apprehension of conduct.

original: ta zhes bya ba ni 'tshe ba mi dmigs pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o //
analyzed: ta zhes bya ba ni 'tshe ba mi dmigs pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o //
translated: “The syllable ta is the gateway to all phenomena because of the non-apprehension of harm.

original: ha zhes bya ba ni ngar 'dzin pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o //
analyzed: ha zhes bya ba ni ngar 'dzin pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o //
translated: “The syllable ha is the gateway to all phenomena because of the non-apprehension of grasping at ‘I.’

original: de yan chad yi ge'i tha snyad med do //
analyzed: de yan chad yi ge'i tha snyad med do //
translated: “Beyond that, there are no more conventions of syllables.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar gang la yang gang gis tha snyad du bya ba dang / gang gis rjod pa dang / gang gis bstan pa dang / gang gis rtogs par byed pa dang / gang gis mthong ba'i ming ni 'ga' yang med do //
analyzed: 'di ltar gang la yang gang gis tha snyad du bya ba dang / gang gis rjod pa dang / gang gis bstan pa dang / gang gis rtogs par byed pa dang / gang gis mthong ba'i ming ni 'ga' yang med do //
translated: In this way, there is no name whatsoever for anything that is conventionally designated, expressed, taught, realized, or seen.

original: rab 'byor 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di lta ste /
translated: Subhūti, it is like this:

original: chos thams cad ni dpe nam mkha' bzhin du khong du chud par bya ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni dpe nam mkha' bzhin du khong du chud par bya ste /
translated: all phenomena should be understood to be like space.

original: rab 'byor 'di ni gzungs kyi sgo la 'jug pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di ni gzungs kyi sgo la 'jug pa /
translated: Subhūti, this is the entrance into the dhāraṇī gateway,

original: aa la sogs pa'i yi ge bstan pa la 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: aa la sogs pa'i yi ge bstan pa la 'jug pa'o //
translated: the entrance into the teaching of the letters beginning with A.

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang la la zhig gis aa la sogs pa'i yi ge la mkhas par bya ba 'di yongs su shes na de ni sgra gang la yang thogs par mi 'gyur zhing de thams cad mnyam pa nyid kyi🔽chos nyid du sgrub par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang la la zhig gis aa la sogs pa'i yi ge la mkhas par bya ba 'di yongs su shes na de ni sgra gang la yang thogs par mi 'gyur zhing de thams cad mnyam pa nyid kyi chos nyid du sgrub par 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, Subhūti, if any bodhisattva mahāsattva understands this skill in the letters beginning with A, they will not be obstructed by any sound and will accomplish all of them as the reality of sameness,

original: sgra shes par bya ba la mkhas pa thob par 'gyur ro /
analyzed: sgra shes par bya ba la mkhas pa thob par 'gyur ro /
translated: and will attain skill in understanding sounds.

original: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' gang la la zhig aa la sogs pa'i yi ge'i phyag rgya 'di dag la sogs pa'i yi ge la nyan cing thos nas kyang 'dzin pa dang / 'chang ba dang / klog pa dang / kun chub par byed cing /
analyzed: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' gang la la zhig aa la sogs pa'i yi ge'i phyag rgya 'di dag la sogs pa'i yi ge la nyan cing thos nas kyang 'dzin pa dang / 'chang ba dang / klog pa dang / kun chub par byed cing /
translated: Subhūti, if any bodhisattva hears these seals of the letters beginning with A, and having heard them, upholds them,

original: gzhan dag la yang tshul dang ldan pa'i blos ston na /
analyzed: gzhan dag la yang tshul dang ldan pa'i blos ston na /
translated: and teaches them to others with a proper mind,

original: de la legs pa nyi shu yod par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de la legs pa nyi shu yod par shes par bya'o //
translated: one should know that there are twenty benefits.

original: nyi shu gang zhe na /
analyzed: nyi shu gang zhe na /
translated: What are the twenty?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: dran pa dang ldan par 'gyur /
analyzed: dran pa dang ldan par 'gyur /
translated: One will be endowed with mindfulness.

original: blo gros dang ldan par 'gyur /
analyzed: blo gros dang ldan par 'gyur /
translated: One will be endowed with intelligence.

original: rtogs pa dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rtogs pa dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: One will be endowed with realization.

original: blo dang ldan par 'gyur /
analyzed: blo dang ldan par 'gyur /
translated: One will be endowed with wisdom.

original: brtan pa dang ldan par 'gyur /
analyzed: brtan pa dang ldan par 'gyur /
translated: One will be endowed with stability.

original: ngo tsha shes la dang ldan par 'gyur /
analyzed: ngo tsha shes la dang ldan par 'gyur /
translated: One will be endowed with a sense of shame.

original: shes rab dang ldan par 'gyur /
analyzed: shes rab dang ldan par 'gyur /
translated: One will be endowed with insight.

original: spobs pa dang ldan par 'gyur ba dang / gzungs kyi sgo 'di yang tshegs chung ngus thob par 'gyur /
analyzed: spobs pa dang ldan par 'gyur ba dang / gzungs kyi sgo 'di yang tshegs chung ngus thob par 'gyur /
translated: One will be endowed with eloquence, and one will easily attain this dhāraṇī gateway.

original: de la som nyi med par 'gyur /
analyzed: de la som nyi med par 'gyur /
translated: One will be free from doubt.

original: yid gnyis med par 'gyur /🔽gzhan la sgra'i ngag snyan pa thos kyang chags par 'gyur ba med cing tshig rtsub pos khong khro bar mi 'gyur @236b zhing mtho bar mi 'gyur /
analyzed: yid gnyis med par 'gyur / gzhan la sgra'i ngag snyan pa thos kyang chags par 'gyur ba med cing tshig rtsub pos khong khro bar mi 'gyur @236b zhing mtho bar mi 'gyur /
translated: They will be free of doubt.

original: dma' bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: dma' bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: Even if they hear pleasant sounds from others, they will not be attached. They will not be angry or irritated by unpleasant sounds. They will not be arrogant or contemptuous.🔽They will remain as they are.

original: ji lta ba bzhin gnas par 'gyur ba dang / sgra la mkhas par 'gyur ba dang / phung po la mkhas par 'gyur ba dang / khams la mkhas par 'gyur ba dang / skye mched la mkhas par 'gyur ba dang / bden pa la mkhas par 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: ji lta ba bzhin gnas par 'gyur ba dang / sgra la mkhas par 'gyur ba dang / phung po la mkhas par 'gyur ba dang / khams la mkhas par 'gyur ba dang / skye mched la mkhas par 'gyur ba dang / bden pa la mkhas par 'gyur ba dang /
translated: They will be skilled in sound, skilled in the aggregates, skilled in the elements, skilled in the sense sources, skilled in the truths,

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la mkhas par 'gyur ba dang / rgyu la mkhas par 'gyur ba dang / rkyen la mkhas par 'gyur ba dang / chos nyid la mkhas par 'gyur ba dang / dbang po mchog dang mchog ma yin pa shes pa la mkhas par 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la mkhas par 'gyur ba dang / rgyu la mkhas par 'gyur ba dang / rkyen la mkhas par 'gyur ba dang / chos nyid la mkhas par 'gyur ba dang / dbang po mchog dang mchog ma yin pa shes pa la mkhas par 'gyur ba dang /
translated: skilled in dependent origination, skilled in causes, skilled in conditions, skilled in reality, skilled in knowing the highest and the not highest,

original: pha rol gyi sems shes pa la mkhas par 'gyur ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi bya ba shes pa la mkhas par 'gyur ba dang / lha'i rna ba'i shes pa la mkhas par 'gyur ba dang / sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa shes pa la mkhas par 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: pha rol gyi sems shes pa la mkhas par 'gyur ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi bya ba shes pa la mkhas par 'gyur ba dang / lha'i rna ba'i shes pa la mkhas par 'gyur ba dang / sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa shes pa la mkhas par 'gyur ba dang /
translated: They will become skilled in knowing the minds of others, skilled in knowing the activity of miracles, skilled in knowing the divine ear, skilled in knowing the recollection of past lives,

original: 'chi 'pho ba dang skye ba shes pa la mkhas par 'gyur ba dang / zag pa zad pa shes pa la mkhas par 'gyur ba dang / gnas dang gnas ma yin pa bstan pa shes pa la mkhas par 'gyur ba dang / 'gro ba la mkhas shing ldog pa la mkhas par 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: 'chi 'pho ba dang skye ba shes pa la mkhas par 'gyur ba dang / zag pa zad pa shes pa la mkhas par 'gyur ba dang / gnas dang gnas ma yin pa bstan pa shes pa la mkhas par 'gyur ba dang / 'gro ba la mkhas shing ldog pa la mkhas par 'gyur ba dang /
translated: skilled in knowing death and rebirth, skilled in knowing the exhaustion of defilements, skilled in knowing what is possible and impossible, skilled in knowing how to go and how to turn back,

original: spyod lam la mkhas par 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: spyod lam la mkhas par 'gyur ba ste /
translated: and skilled in knowing how to behave.

original: phan yon nyi shu bo 'di dag thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phan yon nyi shu bo 'di dag thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will attain these twenty benefits.

original: rab 'byor gzungs kyi sgo aa la sogs pa'i yi ge la 'jug pa 'di yang de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i theg pa chen po'o zhes bya ba ni gzungs kyi tshogs so //
analyzed: rab 'byor gzungs kyi sgo aa la sogs pa'i yi ge la 'jug pa 'di yang de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i theg pa chen po'o zhes bya ba ni gzungs kyi tshogs so //
translated: “Subhūti, this gateway to dhāraṇīs, the entry into the letters such as A, is also the Great Vehicle of the bodhisattva great beings, because it is not apprehended.

original: rab 'byor gang yang khyod kyis 'di skad du ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa yin zhes zer ba ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor gang yang khyod kyis 'di skad du ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa yin zhes zer ba ni /
translated: “Subhūti, you asked, ‘How are bodhisattva great beings to be known as having set out in the Great Vehicle?’

original: rab 'byor 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod cing sa nas sar 'phar te /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod cing sa nas sar 'phar te /
translated: Subhūti, here bodhisattva great beings practicing the six perfections progress from ground to ground.

original: rab 'byor ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod cing sa nas sar 'phar ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: rab 'byor ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod cing sa nas sar 'phar ba yin zhe na /
translated: “Subhūti, how do bodhisattva great beings practicing the six perfections progress from ground to ground?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: chos thams cad la 'pho ba med pas so //
analyzed: chos thams cad la 'pho ba med pas so //
translated: because all phenomena are without transference.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: chos gang yang 'ong ba'am 'gro ba'am /
analyzed: chos gang yang 'ong ba'am 'gro ba'am /
translated: No dharma comes or goes,

original: 'pho ba'am / nye bar 'pho ba med de /
analyzed: 'pho ba'am / nye bar 'pho ba med de /
translated: nor does it move or shift.

original: 'on kyang chos thams cad kyis gang yin pa de la rlom sems su mi byed cing mi sems la sa yongs @237a * //
analyzed: 'on kyang chos thams cad kyis gang yin pa de la rlom sems su mi byed cing mi sems la sa yongs @237a * //
translated: And yet, with regard to what is, bodhisattvas do not entertain any concepts, and they do not think about it.

original: su sbyong ba yang byed cing sa de yang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: su sbyong ba yang byed cing sa de yang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: They purify the grounds, and yet they do not see those grounds.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sa yongs su sbyong ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sa yongs su sbyong ba gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the purification of the bodhisattva great beings’ grounds?”

original: rab 'byor sa dang po la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos yongs su sbyang ba bcu po 'di dag bya ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor sa dang po la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos yongs su sbyang ba bcu po 'di dag bya ste /
translated: “Subhūti, the bodhisattva great beings who are on the first ground should perform ten purifications.

original: bcu gang zhe na /
analyzed: bcu gang zhe na /
translated: What are the ten?

original: de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis lhag pa'i bsam pa yongs su sbyang ba dang / mtshan ma mi dmigs pa'i phyir phan pa'i dngos po yongs su sbyang zhing /
analyzed: de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis lhag pa'i bsam pa yongs su sbyang ba dang / mtshan ma mi dmigs pa'i phyir phan pa'i dngos po yongs su sbyang zhing /
translated: They should purify their superior intention by way of nonapprehending, and they should purify the things that are helpful by not apprehending signs.

original: sems can mi dmigs pa'i phyir sems can thams cad la sems mnyam pa nyid yongs su sbyang ba dang / sbyin pa dang gtong ba dang / len pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir gtong ba yongs su sbyang ba dang / des rlom sems su mi bya ba'i phyir dge ba'i bshes gnyen bsten pa yongs su sbyang ba dang /
analyzed: sems can mi dmigs pa'i phyir sems can thams cad la sems mnyam pa nyid yongs su sbyang ba dang / sbyin pa dang gtong ba dang / len pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir gtong ba yongs su sbyang ba dang / des rlom sems su mi bya ba'i phyir dge ba'i bshes gnyen bsten pa yongs su sbyang ba dang /
translated: It is to purify the attitude of equality towards all sentient beings because sentient beings are not perceived. It is to purify giving because giving, giving things up, and receiving are not perceived.

original: chos thams cad mi dmigs pa'i phyir chos btsal ba yongs su sbyang ba dang / khyim mi dmigs pa'i phyir yang dang yang du 'byung ba yongs su sbyang ba dang / mtshan dang dpe byad bzang po'i mtshan ma mi dmigs pa'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi sku la 'dod pa yongs su sbyang ba dang /
analyzed: chos thams cad mi dmigs pa'i phyir chos btsal ba yongs su sbyang ba dang / khyim mi dmigs pa'i phyir yang dang yang du 'byung ba yongs su sbyang ba dang / mtshan dang dpe byad bzang po'i mtshan ma mi dmigs pa'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi sku la 'dod pa yongs su sbyang ba dang /
translated: It is to purify attending to spiritual teachers because one does not become conceited about that. It is to purify the search for the Dharma because all phenomena are not perceived. It is to purify the repeated arising because a home is not perceived. It is to purify the desire for the body of a buddha because the signs and features of the major and minor marks are not perceived.

original: chos kyi dbye ba mi dmigs pa'i phyir chos rnam par 'grel pa yongs su sbyang ba dang / chos kyi yod pa nyid mi dmigs pa'i phyir nga rgyal gyi khengs pa bsal ba nyid yongs su spyad pa dang / tshig mi dmigs pa'i phyir bden pa'i tshig yongs su sbyang ba ste /
analyzed: chos kyi dbye ba mi dmigs pa'i phyir chos rnam par 'grel pa yongs su sbyang ba dang / chos kyi yod pa nyid mi dmigs pa'i phyir nga rgyal gyi khengs pa bsal ba nyid yongs su spyad pa dang / tshig mi dmigs pa'i phyir bden pa'i tshig yongs su sbyang ba ste /
translated: the purification of the explanation of the Dharma, because of the non-apprehension of the differentiation of the Dharma; the purification of the elimination of pride, because of the non-apprehension of the existence of the Dharma; and the purification of the truth of speech, because of the non-apprehension of speech.

original: rab 'byor yongs su sbyang ba bcu po de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sa dang po la gnas pas bya ba dag go //
analyzed: rab 'byor yongs su sbyang ba bcu po de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sa dang po la gnas pas bya ba dag go //
translated: Subhuti, these ten purifications are those which the Bodhisattva, the great being, who dwells in the first stage, should perform.

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sa gnyis pa la gnas pas chos brgyad po 'di dag yang dang yang du yid la bya zhing de dag la nan tan du bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sa gnyis pa la gnas pas chos brgyad po 'di dag yang dang yang du yid la bya zhing de dag la nan tan du bya'o //
translated: Furthermore, Subhuti, the Bodhisattva, the great being, who dwells in the second stage, should repeatedly bring to mind and practice eight dharmas.

original: brgyad gang zho na /
analyzed: brgyad gang zho na /
translated: What are the eight?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: tshul khrims yongs su dag pa dang / byas pa shes shing byas pa tshor ba dang / bzod pa'i stobs la gnas pa dang / rab tu dga' ba nyams su myong bar byas pa dang / sems can thams cad yongs su mi gtong ba dang /
analyzed: tshul khrims yongs su dag pa dang / byas pa shes shing byas pa tshor ba dang / bzod pa'i stobs la gnas pa dang / rab tu dga' ba nyams su myong bar byas pa dang / sems can thams cad yongs su mi gtong ba dang /
translated: They are: pure morality, knowing what has been done and being grateful, abiding in the power of patience, experiencing great joy, never abandoning any sentient being,

original: snying rje chen po mngon du bya ba dang / bla ma la dad pas bsnyen bkur byed cing ston pa'i 'du shes kyis gus par tan pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la brtson pas 'tshol ba ste /
analyzed: snying rje chen po mngon du bya ba dang / bla ma la dad pas bsnyen bkur byed cing ston pa'i 'du shes kyis gus par tan pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la brtson pas 'tshol ba ste /
translated: manifesting great compassion, serving the guru with faith and respect, and seeking the perfections with diligence.

original: @237b rab 'byor chos brgyad po 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sa gnyis pa la gnas pas yang dang yang du yid la bya zhing de dag la nan tan du bya ba dag go //
analyzed: @237b rab 'byor chos brgyad po 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sa gnyis pa la gnas pas yang dang yang du yid la bya zhing de dag la nan tan du bya ba dag go //
translated: Subhūti, these eight dharmas are those that the bodhisattva mahāsattvas dwelling on the second ground should repeatedly keep in mind and practice.

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sa gsum pa la gnas pas chos lnga la gnas par bya ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sa gsum pa la gnas pas chos lnga la gnas par bya ste /

original: rab 'byor chos bcu po 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sa bzhi pa la gnas pas yongs su gtang bar mi bya zhing /
analyzed: rab 'byor chos bcu po 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sa bzhi pa la gnas pas yongs su gtang bar mi bya zhing /
translated: “Subhūti, these ten dharmas are not to be abandoned by bodhisattva great beings on the fourth ground,

analyzed: yang dag par blangs te gnas par bya ba dag go //

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sa lnga pa la gnas pas chos bcu po 'di dag yongs su spang bar bya ste /

analyzed: bcu gang zhe na /
translated: What are the ten?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /

original: la ser sna byad pa yongs su spang bar bya ba dang / 'du 'dzi'i gnas yongs su spang bar bya ba dang / gnod sems yongs su spang bar bya ba dang / bdag la bstod par bya ba dang / gzhan la smod pa yongs su spang bar bya ba'o //

original: mi dge ba bcu'i lam yongs su spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: mi dge ba bcu'i lam yongs su spang bar bya'o //
translated: and abandoning the ten unwholesome courses of action.

original: lhag pa'i nga rgyal dang / khengs pa dang / phyin ci log rnams dang / the tshom dang / 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug nyams rangs su gzhag pa yongs su spang bar bya'o //
