translated: and delusion.

original: chos bcu po de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sa lnga pa la gnas pas yongs su spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: chos bcu po de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sa lnga pa la gnas pas yongs su spang bar bya'o //
translated: These ten dharmas should be given up by the bodhisattva great being on the fifth ground.

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sa drug pa la gnas pas chos drug po yongs su rdzogs par bya ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sa drug pa la gnas pas chos drug po yongs su rdzogs par bya ste /
translated: “Furthermore, Subhūti, the bodhisattva great being on the sixth ground should complete six dharmas.

original: drug gang zhe na /
analyzed: drug gang zhe na /
translated: What are the six?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug go //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug go //
translated: the six perfections.

original: gzhan yang chos drug yongs su spang bar bya ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang chos drug yongs su spang bar bya ste /
translated: Furthermore, he should give up six dharmas.

original: drug gang zhe na /
analyzed: drug gang zhe na /
translated: What are the six?

original: nyan thos kyi sems yongs su spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi sems yongs su spang bar bya'o //
translated: He should give up the śrāvaka mind.

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi sems yongs su spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi sems yongs su spang bar bya'o //
translated: He should give up the pratyekabuddha mind.

original: skrag pa'i sems yongs su spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: skrag pa'i sems yongs su spang bar bya'o //
translated: He should give up a frightened mind.

original: slong mo pa mthong na zhum pa med par bya ste /
analyzed: slong mo pa mthong na zhum pa med par bya ste /
translated: When he sees a beggar, he should not be discouraged.

original: zhum pa'i sems yongs su spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: zhum pa'i sems yongs su spang bar bya'o //
translated: He should completely avoid a discouraged mind.

original: dngos po thams cad yongs su btang bas yid mi bde bar mi bya ste /
analyzed: dngos po thams cad yongs su btang bas yid mi bde bar mi bya ste /
translated: He should not be unhappy about giving away all his possessions.

original: yid mi bde ba yongs su spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: yid mi bde ba yongs su spang bar bya'o //
translated: He should completely avoid unhappiness.

original: slong mo pa mthong na slong mo pas 'khrugs par mi bya ste /
analyzed: slong mo pa mthong na slong mo pas 'khrugs par mi bya ste /
translated: When he sees a beggar, he should not be upset by the beggar.

original: 'khrugs pa'i sems yongs su spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'khrugs pa'i sems yongs su spang bar bya'o //
translated: He should completely avoid an upset mind.

original: rab 'byor chos drug po de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sa drug pa la gnas pas yongs su spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor chos drug po de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sa drug pa la gnas pas yongs su spang bar bya'o //
translated: Subhūti, these six dharmas should be abandoned by bodhisattva great beings on the sixth ground.

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sa bdun pa la gnas pas chos nyi shu mi bya ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sa bdun pa la gnas pas chos nyi shu mi bya ste /
translated: “Furthermore, Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings on the seventh ground should not do twenty dharmas.

original: nyi shu gang zhe na /
analyzed: nyi shu gang zhe na /
translated: What are the twenty?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: bdag tu 'dzin par mi bya'o //
analyzed: bdag tu 'dzin par mi bya'o //
translated: They should not grasp at a self.

original: sems can du 'dzin pa dang / srog tu 'dzin pa dang / gang zag tu 'dzin pa dang / chad par 'dzin pa dang / rtag par 'dzin pa dang / mtshan ma'i 'du shes dang / rgyur lta ba dang / ming dang gzugs la mngon par chags pa dang /
analyzed: sems can du 'dzin pa dang / srog tu 'dzin pa dang / gang zag tu 'dzin pa dang / chad par 'dzin pa dang / rtag par 'dzin pa dang / mtshan ma'i 'du shes dang / rgyur lta ba dang / ming dang gzugs la mngon par chags pa dang /
translated: attachment to name and form,🔽attachment to the aggregates,🔽attachment to the elements,🔽attachment to the sense sources,🔽dwelling in the three realms,🔽clinging to the three realms,

original: phung po la mngon par chags pa dang / khams la mngon par chags pa dang / skye mched la mngon par chags pa dang / khams @238b gsum na gnas pa dang / khams gsum la mngon par zhen pa dang / khams gsum la brten pa dang /
analyzed: phung po la mngon par chags pa dang / khams la mngon par chags pa dang / skye mched la mngon par chags pa dang / khams @238b gsum na gnas pa dang / khams gsum la mngon par zhen pa dang / khams gsum la brten pa dang /
translated: relying on the three realms,🔽attachment to views that rely on the Buddha,🔽attachment to views that rely on the Dharma,🔽attachment to views that rely on the Saṅgha,

original: sangs rgyas la brten pa'i lta ba la mngon par chags pa dang / chos la brten pa'i lta ba la mngon par chags pa dang / dge 'dun la brten pa'i lta ba la mngon par chags pa dang / tshul khrims la brten pa'i lta ba la mngon par chags pa dang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas la brten pa'i lta ba la mngon par chags pa dang / chos la brten pa'i lta ba la mngon par chags pa dang / dge 'dun la brten pa'i lta ba la mngon par chags pa dang / tshul khrims la brten pa'i lta ba la mngon par chags pa dang /
translated: attachment to views that rely on discipline,

original: chos rnams stong ngo zhes zhum par 'gyur ba dang / stong pa nyid dang 'gal ba ste /
analyzed: chos rnams stong ngo zhes zhum par 'gyur ba dang / stong pa nyid dang 'gal ba ste /
translated: They are: All phenomena are empty, and to be discouraged, and to contradict emptiness.

original: rab 'byor chos nyi shu po 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sa bdun pa la gnas pas mi bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor chos nyi shu po 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sa bdun pa la gnas pas mi bya'o //
translated: Subhūti, these twenty dharmas should not be done by bodhisattva mahāsattvas dwelling on the seventh ground.

original: des chos nyi shu po 'di dag yongs su rdzogs par bya ste /
analyzed: des chos nyi shu po 'di dag yongs su rdzogs par bya ste /
translated: They should complete twenty dharmas.

original: nyi shu gang zhe na /
analyzed: nyi shu gang zhe na /
translated: What are the twenty?

original: stong pa nyid rdzogs par bya ba dang / mtshan ma med pa mngon du bya ba dang / smon pa med pa shes par bya ba dang / 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa dang / sems can thams cad la snying rje zhing snying brtse ba dang /
analyzed: stong pa nyid rdzogs par bya ba dang / mtshan ma med pa mngon du bya ba dang / smon pa med pa shes par bya ba dang / 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa dang / sems can thams cad la snying rje zhing snying brtse ba dang /
translated: Completing emptiness, manifesting the signless, understanding the wishless, the three spheres being pure, compassion and love for all sentient beings,

original: sems can de dag la brnyas par mi bya ba dang / chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid du lta zhing de la yang mngon par zhen pa med pa dang / yang dag pa'i tshul rab tu rtogs te des kyang mi rlom pa dang / mi skye ba shes pa dang /
analyzed: sems can de dag la brnyas par mi bya ba dang / chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid du lta zhing de la yang mngon par zhen pa med pa dang / yang dag pa'i tshul rab tu rtogs te des kyang mi rlom pa dang / mi skye ba shes pa dang /
translated: not to despise those sentient beings, to see all phenomena as equality and not to be attached to that, to realize the correct way and not to be proud of that, to know that phenomena are unborn,

original: chos thams cad tshul gcig tu bstan pa dang / rtogs pa yang dag par gsal ba dang / lta ba rnam par bzlog pa dang / nyon mongs pa rnam par bzlog pa dang / zhi gnas la nges par sems pa dang / lhag mthong la mkhas pa dang /
analyzed: chos thams cad tshul gcig tu bstan pa dang / rtogs pa yang dag par gsal ba dang / lta ba rnam par bzlog pa dang / nyon mongs pa rnam par bzlog pa dang / zhi gnas la nges par sems pa dang / lhag mthong la mkhas pa dang /
translated: to teach all phenomena as a single way, to clarify realization, to turn away from views, to turn away from afflictions, to be certain about śamatha, to be skilled in vipaśyanā,

original: sems dul ba dang / thams cad thogs pa med pa'i shes pa dang / chags pa'i sa ma yin pa dang / gang du 'dod pa'i zhing du 'gro ba dang der yang sangs rgyas kyi 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor du gnas nas bdag gi dngos po ston pa ste /
analyzed: sems dul ba dang / thams cad thogs pa med pa'i shes pa dang / chags pa'i sa ma yin pa dang / gang du 'dod pa'i zhing du 'gro ba dang der yang sangs rgyas kyi 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor du gnas nas bdag gi dngos po ston pa ste /
translated: to have a disciplined mind, to have unobstructed knowledge of everything, to not be on the level of attachment, to go to any buddhafield that one wishes, and to manifest one’s own body while remaining in the maṇḍala of the retinue of buddhas there.

original: rab 'byor chos nyi shu po de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sa bdun pa la gnas pas yongs su rdzogs par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor chos nyi shu po de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sa bdun pa la gnas pas yongs su rdzogs par bya'o //
translated: “Subhūti, those twenty dharmas are to be completed by bodhisattva great beings standing on the seventh level.

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sa brgyad pa la gnas pas chos bzhi po 'di dag yongs su rdzogs par bya ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sa brgyad pa la gnas pas chos bzhi po 'di dag yongs su rdzogs par bya ste /
translated: “Furthermore, Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings standing on the eighth level complete four dharmas.

original: bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four?

original: 'di ltar sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi rjes su 'jug pa dang / mngon par shes pas rnam par brtse ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing lta zhing sangs rgyas kyi zhing ji ltar mthong ba de dag @239a * //
analyzed: 'di ltar sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi rjes su 'jug pa dang / mngon par shes pas rnam par brtse ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing lta zhing sangs rgyas kyi zhing ji ltar mthong ba de dag @239a * //
translated: They are: entering into the minds of all beings, playing with the superknowledges, seeing the buddhafields and accomplishing those buddhafields just as they have seen them,

original: yongs su sgrub pa dang / sangs rgyas bsnyen bkur zhing sangs rgyas kyi sku yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du brtag pa ste /
analyzed: yongs su sgrub pa dang / sangs rgyas bsnyen bkur zhing sangs rgyas kyi sku yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du brtag pa ste /
translated: serving the buddhas, and investigating the body of a buddha just as it is.

original: rab 'byor chos bzhi po 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sa brgyad pa la gnas pas yongs su rdzogs par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor chos bzhi po 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sa brgyad pa la gnas pas yongs su rdzogs par bya'o //
translated: “Subhūti, these four dharmas are to be completed by bodhisattva great beings standing on the eighth level.

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sa brgyad pa la gnas pas chos bzhi yongs su rdzogs par bya ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sa brgyad pa la gnas pas chos bzhi yongs su rdzogs par bya ste /
translated: “Furthermore, Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings standing on the eighth level complete four dharmas.

original: bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are these:

original: dbang po mchog dang mchog ma yin pa shes pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su sbyong ba dang / sgyu ma lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin la yang dang yang mnyam par 'jog pa dang / sems can rnams kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba ji lta ji ltar 'grub par 'gyur ba de lta de lta bu'i lus yongs su sgrub cing ched du bsams shing srid pa nye bar len pa ste /
analyzed: dbang po mchog dang mchog ma yin pa shes pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su sbyong ba dang / sgyu ma lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin la yang dang yang mnyam par 'jog pa dang / sems can rnams kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba ji lta ji ltar 'grub par 'gyur ba de lta de lta bu'i lus yongs su sgrub cing ched du bsams shing srid pa nye bar len pa ste /
translated: knowing the superior and the not superior, purifying a buddhafield, repeatedly settling into the illusion-like meditative stabilization, and taking up existence intentionally in order to accomplish a body in whatever way is necessary to bring about the roots of virtue in beings.

original: rab 'byor chos bzhi po de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sa brgyad pa la gnas bag yongs su rdzogs par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor chos bzhi po de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sa brgyad pa la gnas bag yongs su rdzogs par bya'o //
translated: “Subhūti, those four dharmas should be completed by bodhisattva great beings standing on the eighth level.”

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sa dgu pa la gnas pas chos bcu gnyis yongs su rdzogs par bya ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sa dgu pa la gnas pas chos bcu gnyis yongs su rdzogs par bya ste /
translated: “Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings standing on the ninth level should complete twelve dharmas.

original: bcu gnyis gang zhe na /
analyzed: bcu gnyis gang zhe na /
translated: What are the twelve?

original: 'di ltar smon lam mtha' yas yongs su bzung ba ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar smon lam mtha' yas yongs su bzung ba ste /
translated: They are as follows: taking up infinite prayers;

original: ji lta ji ltar smon pa de lta de ltar phun sum tshogs par 'gyur ba dang / lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi 'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po'i skad shes pa dang /
analyzed: ji lta ji ltar smon pa de lta de ltar phun sum tshogs par 'gyur ba dang / lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi 'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po'i skad shes pa dang /
translated: knowing the languages of gods, nāgas, yakṣas, gandharvas, asuras, garuḍas, kinnaras, and mahoragas;

original: yongs su rdzogs pa'i spobs pas nges par bstan pa shes pa dang / ma'i mngal du 'gro ba phun sum tshogs pa dang / rigs phun sum tshogs pa dang / rus phun sum tshogs pa dang / rgyud phun sum tshogs pa dang / 'khor phun sum tshogs pa dang /
analyzed: yongs su rdzogs pa'i spobs pas nges par bstan pa shes pa dang / ma'i mngal du 'gro ba phun sum tshogs pa dang / rigs phun sum tshogs pa dang / rus phun sum tshogs pa dang / rgyud phun sum tshogs pa dang / 'khor phun sum tshogs pa dang /
translated: the knowledge of teaching through fully perfected eloquence, the perfection of going to the mother’s womb, the perfection of family, the perfection of clan, the perfection of lineage, the perfection of retinue,

original: skye ba phun sum tshogs pa dang / mngon par 'byung ba phun sum tshogs pa dang / byang chub kyi shing gi rgyan phun sum tshogs pa dang / yon tan thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa phun sum tshogs pa ste /
analyzed: skye ba phun sum tshogs pa dang / mngon par 'byung ba phun sum tshogs pa dang / byang chub kyi shing gi rgyan phun sum tshogs pa dang / yon tan thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa phun sum tshogs pa ste /
translated: the perfection of birth, the perfection of leaving home, the perfection of adorning the Bodhi tree, and the perfection of fully perfecting all good qualities.

original: rab 'byor chos bcu gnyis po de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sa dgu pa la gnas pas yongs su rdzogs par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor chos bcu gnyis po de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sa dgu pa la gnas pas yongs su rdzogs par bya'o //
translated: Subhūti, these twelve dharmas are to be fully perfected by bodhisattva great beings on the ninth ground.

original: rab 'byor sa bcu pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni de @239b bzhin gshegs pa nyid du brjod do //
analyzed: rab 'byor sa bcu pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni de @239b bzhin gshegs pa nyid du brjod do //
translated: Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings on the tenth ground are said to be tathāgatas.

original: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: The Lord having said that, the venerable Subhūti said to him,

original: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i lhag pa'i bsam pa la sogs pa yongs su sbyang ba gang lags /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i lhag pa'i bsam pa la sogs pa yongs su sbyang ba gang lags /
translated: “Lord, what is the bodhisattva great beings’ purification of superior attitude, and so on?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,

original: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pas dge ba'i rtsa ba mang po yang dag par sdud pa gang yin pa 'di ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pas dge ba'i rtsa ba mang po yang dag par sdud pa gang yin pa 'di ni /
translated: “Subhūti, the bodhisattva great beings’ gathering of many wholesome roots with the thought that is the thought of awakening connected with the knowledge of all aspects is the bodhisattva great beings’ purification of superior attitude.

original: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po lhag pa'i bsam pa yongs su sbyang ba'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po lhag pa'i bsam pa yongs su sbyang ba'o //
translated: Subhūti, that is the bodhisattva great beings’ purification of superior attitude.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po phan pa'i dngos po yongs su sbyang ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po phan pa'i dngos po yongs su sbyang ba gang zhe na /
translated: “What, Subhūti, is the bodhisattva great beings’ purification of the beneficial thing?

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang sems can thams cad kyi don du theg pa chen po'i ye shes tshol zhing sgrub par byed pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po phan pa'i dngos po yongs su sbyang ba yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang sems can thams cad kyi don du theg pa chen po'i ye shes tshol zhing sgrub par byed pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po phan pa'i dngos po yongs su sbyang ba yin no //
translated: The bodhisattva great being who seeks and accomplishes the gnosis of the Great Vehicle for the sake of all sentient beings—this is the bodhisattva great being’s purification of the thing that is helpful.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sems can thams cad la sems mnyam pa nyid yongs su sbyang ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sems can thams cad la sems mnyam pa nyid yongs su sbyang ba gang zhe na /
translated: What, you may ask, is the bodhisattva great being’s purification of the attitude of sameness towards all sentient beings?

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pas tshad med pa bzhi po byams pa dang / snying rje dang / dga' ba dang / btang snyoms mngon par sgrub pa gang yin pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sems can thams cad la sems mnyam pa nyid yongs su sbyang ba'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pas tshad med pa bzhi po byams pa dang / snying rje dang / dga' ba dang / btang snyoms mngon par sgrub pa gang yin pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sems can thams cad la sems mnyam pa nyid yongs su sbyang ba'o //
translated: The bodhisattva great being’s accomplishment of the four immeasurables—love, compassion, joy, and equanimity—with the generation of the mind of omniscience—this is the bodhisattva great being’s purification of the attitude of sameness towards all sentient beings.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i gtong ba yongs su sbyang ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i gtong ba yongs su sbyang ba gang zhe na /
translated: “What, you may wonder, does the bodhisattvas’ training in generosity consist in?

original: sems can thams cad la rnam par rtog pa med par sbyin pa yongs su gtong ba gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: sems can thams cad la rnam par rtog pa med par sbyin pa yongs su gtong ba gang yin pa ste /
translated: It is the generosity that is given to all beings without any concepts.

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gtong ba yongs su sbyang bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gtong ba yongs su sbyang bar bya ba'o //
translated: This is the bodhisattvas’ training in generosity.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen bsten pa yongs su sbyang ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen bsten pa yongs su sbyang ba gang zhe na /
translated: “What, you may wonder, does the bodhisattvas’ training in attending to spiritual teachers consist in?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows.

original: gang de la rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du yang dag par bskul ba dang / gzhog pa dang / rab tu gzhog par byed pa de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen te /
analyzed: gang de la rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du yang dag par bskul ba dang / gzhog pa dang / rab tu gzhog par byed pa de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen te /
translated: Those who encourage, introduce, and establish others in omniscience are the bodhisattvas’ spiritual teachers.

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen de dag bsten pa @240a * //
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen de dag bsten pa @240a * //
translated: Attending to those spiritual teachers

original: dang ; rim gror bya ba dang / bkur stir bya ba dang / bsti stang du bya ba gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: dang ; rim gror bya ba dang / bkur stir bya ba dang / bsti stang du bya ba gang yin pa ste /
translated: and to be served, honored, and revered.

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen bsten pa yongs su sbyang ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen bsten pa yongs su sbyang ba'o //
translated: This is the bodhisattva great beings’ purification of attending on spiritual friends.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i chos btsal ba yongs su sbyang ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i chos btsal ba yongs su sbyang ba gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the bodhisattva great beings’ purification of seeking the Dharma?

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pas chos tshol zhing nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sar mi ltung ba 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i chos btsal pa yongs su sbyang ba'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pas chos tshol zhing nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sar mi ltung ba 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i chos btsal pa yongs su sbyang ba'o //
translated: It is seeking the Dharma with the thought ‘I will listen to the Dharma with the thought of the knowledge of all aspects, and not fall to the śrāvaka or pratyekabuddha level.’ This is the bodhisattva great beings’ purification of seeking the Dharma.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i yang dang yang nges par 'byung ba yongs su sbyang ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i yang dang yang nges par 'byung ba yongs su sbyang ba gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the bodhisattva great beings’ purification of again and again going forth?

original: tshe rabs thams cad du 'du 'dzi med par nges par 'byung zhing de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa la rab tu 'byung zhing der yang bar chad byed pa gang yang med pa gang yin pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i yang dang yang nges
analyzed: tshe rabs thams cad du 'du 'dzi med par nges par 'byung zhing de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa la rab tu 'byung zhing der yang bar chad byed pa gang yang med pa gang yin pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i yang dang yang nges
translated: In all their lives, they definitely renounce worldly distractions and go forth in the teachings of the Tathagata. And there, they are not hindered in any way. This is the bodhisattva great beings’ definite renunciation.

original: par 'byung ba yongs su sbyang ba'o //
analyzed: par 'byung ba yongs su sbyang ba'o //
translated: The purification of repeated renunciation is the bodhisattva-mahāsattva’s renunciation in all lives without distraction, and the going forth in the teachings of the Tathāgata, without any obstacles whatsoever.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sangs rgyas kyi sku la 'dod pa yongs su sbyang ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sangs rgyas kyi sku la 'dod pa yongs su sbyang ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is the bodhisattva-mahāsattva’s purification of longing for the Buddha’s body?

original: sangs rgyas kyi sku mthong nas nam rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur gyi bar du sangs rgyas kyi sku yid la bya ba dang / nam yang 'bral bar mi 'gyur ba gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sku mthong nas nam rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur gyi bar du sangs rgyas kyi sku yid la bya ba dang / nam yang 'bral bar mi 'gyur ba gang yin pa ste /
translated: It is the mental attention to the Buddha’s body, without ever being separated from it, from the time of seeing the Buddha’s body until omniscience is attained.

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sangs rgyas kyi sku la mos pa yongs su sbyang ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sangs rgyas kyi sku la mos pa yongs su sbyang ba'o //
translated: This is the bodhisattva-mahāsattva’s purification of longing for the Buddha’s body.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i chos rnam par 'grel pa yongs su sbyang ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i chos rnam par 'grel pa yongs su sbyang ba gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the bodhisattva great beings’ purification of teaching the Dharma?

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de bzhin gshegs pa mngon du 'gyur ba 'am yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i tshe /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de bzhin gshegs pa mngon du 'gyur ba 'am yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i tshe /
translated: When the Tathāgata is present or has passed into Nirvāṇa,

original: sems can rnams la chos ston cing thog mar yang dge / bar du yang dge / tha mar yang dge / yi ge bzang po /
analyzed: sems can rnams la chos ston cing thog mar yang dge / bar du yang dge / tha mar yang dge / yi ge bzang po /
translated: bodhisattva great beings teach the Dharma to beings, which is virtuous in the beginning, virtuous in the middle, and virtuous in the end, with its own meaning, with its own phrasing,

original: don bzang po /
analyzed: don bzang po /
translated: with excellent letters,

original: ma 'dres pa /
analyzed: ma 'dres pa /
translated: unmixed,

original: yongs su rdzogs pa /🔽yongs su dag pa /
analyzed: yongs su rdzogs pa / yongs su dag pa /
translated: complete,🔽pure,

original: yongs su byang ba'i tshangs par spyod pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: yongs su byang ba'i tshangs par spyod pa 'di lta ste /
translated: and purified—that is, the pure life,

original: mdo dang dbyangs kyis bsnyad pa dang / lung bstan pa dang / tshigs su bcad pa dang / ched du brjod pa dang / gleng gzhi dang / 'di ltar 'das pa dang / skyes pa'i rabs dang / shin tu rgyas pa dang / rmad du byung ba dang /
analyzed: mdo dang dbyangs kyis bsnyad pa dang / lung bstan pa dang / tshigs su bcad pa dang / ched du brjod pa dang / gleng gzhi dang / 'di ltar 'das pa dang / skyes pa'i rabs dang / shin tu rgyas pa dang / rmad du byung ba dang /
translated: such as the sūtras, the songs, the prophecies, the verses, the statements, the circumstances, the this-was-so, the birth stories, the amazing events, the extensive teachings, and the instructions.

original: rtogs pa brjod pa dang / gtan la dbab par bstan pa dag yang dag @240b par ston pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: rtogs pa brjod pa dang / gtan la dbab par bstan pa dag yang dag @240b par ston pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: It is the teaching of the sūtras, the geyas, the vyakarṇas, the gāthās, the udānas, the itivṛttakas, the jātakas, the vaipulyas, the adbhūtadharmas, and the upadeśas.

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i chos rnam par dbye ba yongs su sbyang ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i chos rnam par dbye ba yongs su sbyang ba'o //
translated: This is the bodhisattva-mahāsattva’s purification of the analysis of phenomena.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i nga rgyal dang khengs pa bsal ba yongs su sbyang ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i nga rgyal dang khengs pa bsal ba yongs su sbyang ba gang zhe na /
translated: “What, you may wonder, does the bodhisattva-mahāsattva’s purification of the removal of pride and arrogance consist in?

original: nga rgyal dang khengs pa yongs su bsal ba des nam yang rigs dma' bar mi skye ba 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i nga rgyal dang khengs pa bsal ba yongs su sbyang ba'o /🔽// / bam po bco brgyad pa /
analyzed: nga rgyal dang khengs pa yongs su bsal ba des nam yang rigs dma' bar mi skye ba 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i nga rgyal dang khengs pa bsal ba yongs su sbyang ba'o / // / bam po bco brgyad pa /
translated: The bodhisattva-mahāsattva’s purification of the removal of pride and arrogance is such that he will never be born into a low family.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i bden pa'i tshig yongs su sbyang ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i bden pa'i tshig yongs su sbyang ba gang zhe na /
translated: “What, you may wonder, does the bodhisattva-mahāsattva’s purification of truthful speech consist in?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows.

original: ji skad smras pa de ltar byed pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: ji skad smras pa de ltar byed pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: It is to do as one says.

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i bden pa'i tshig yongs su sbyang ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i bden pa'i tshig yongs su sbyang ba'o //
translated: This is the bodhisattva great beings’ purification of truthful speech.

original: rab 'byor de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sa dang po la gnas pa'i yongs su sbyong ba bcu'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sa dang po la gnas pa'i yongs su sbyong ba bcu'o //
translated: Subhūti, these are the ten purifications for the bodhisattva great beings on the first level.

original: rab 'byor de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po tshul khrims yongs su dag pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: rab 'byor de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po tshul khrims yongs su dag pa gang zhe na /
translated: “Subhūti, what is the bodhisattva great beings’ pure morality?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is this:

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sems yid la mi byed cing de ma yin pa'i tshul khrims ngan par byed pa dang / byang chub kyi gegs su 'gyur ba'i chos gzhan dag kyang yid la mi byed pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sems yid la mi byed cing de ma yin pa'i tshul khrims ngan par byed pa dang / byang chub kyi gegs su 'gyur ba'i chos gzhan dag kyang yid la mi byed pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: not paying attention to the śrāvaka and pratyekabuddha thought, and not paying attention to other dharmas that are an obstacle to awakening.

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i tshul khrims yongs su dag pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i tshul khrims yongs su dag pa'o //
translated: This is the bodhisattva great beings’ pure morality.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i byas pa shes shing drin du gzo ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i byas pa shes shing drin du gzo ba gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the bodhisattva great beings’ gratitude and thankfulness?

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa'i tshe phan pa chung ngu zhig kyang 'khor ba ma zad kyi bar du chud mi gson na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa'i tshe phan pa chung ngu zhig kyang 'khor ba ma zad kyi bar du chud mi gson na /
translated: When bodhisattva mahāsattvas practice bodhisattva conduct, they do not waste even a small benefit until saṃsāra is emptied,

original: mang po lta ci smos te /
analyzed: mang po lta ci smos te /
translated: let alone a great one.

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i byas pa shes shing drin du gzo ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i byas pa shes shing drin du gzo ba'o //
translated: This is the bodhisattva mahāsattvas’ gratitude and recognition of a favor.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bzod pa'i mthu la gnas pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bzod pa'i mthu la gnas pa gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the bodhisattva mahāsattvas’ patience and endurance?

original: sems can thams cad la gnod sems med cing 'tshe ba med pa'i sems gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: sems can thams cad la gnod sems med cing 'tshe ba med pa'i sems gang yin pa ste /
translated: It is the absence of malice and the absence of harm toward all beings.

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i bzod pa'i mthu la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i bzod pa'i mthu la gnas pa'o //
translated: This is the bodhisattva mahāsattvas’ patience and endurance.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i rab tu dga' zhing spro ba myong bar bya ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i rab tu dga' zhing spro ba myong bar bya ba gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the bodhisattva mahāsattvas’ experience of joy and delight?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is this:

original: sems can thams cad theg pa @241a * //
analyzed: sems can thams cad theg pa @241a * //
translated: all beings in the three realms are included in the three yānas.

original: gsum la yongs su smin par byed pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: gsum la yongs su smin par byed pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: and the third is bringing them to full maturity.

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i rab tu dga' zhing spro ba myong bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i rab tu dga' zhing spro ba myong bar bya ba'o //
translated: This is the bodhisattva-mahāsattva’s experience of joy and delight.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sems can thams cad yongs su mi gtong ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sems can thams cad yongs su mi gtong ba gang zhe na /
translated: “What, you ask, is the bodhisattva-mahāsattva’s not abandoning any sentient being?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is this:

original: sems can thams cad yongs su skyob pa gang yin pa ste /

analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i snying rje chen po mngon du bya ba'o //

translated: This is the bodhisattva-mahāsattva’s insatiable thirst for learning.

analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i zang zing med par chos kyi sbyin pa rnam par 'byed pa gang zhe na /

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos ston pa'i tshe /

analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i zang zing med par chos kyi sbyin pa rnam par 'byed pa'o //
translated: This is the bodhisattva-mahāsattva’s discernment of the gift of the Dharma that is free of material desires.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bya ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed cing yongs su bsngo ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bya ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed cing yongs su bsngo ba gang zhe na /

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bya ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed cing yongs su bsngo ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bya ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed cing yongs su bsngo ba'o //

analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba gang gis nye bar bstan na sems can yongs su smin par 'gyur ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par 'gyur ba de lta bu'i dge ba'i rtsa ba nye bar ston cing rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yongs su ma rdzogs kyi bar du nam yang skyo bar mi 'gyur ba 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen
translated: “What roots of virtue does he reveal? He reveals the roots of virtue that will ripen beings and purify the buddha realm, and he never tires of doing so until he has perfected omniscience.

analyzed: po'i dpag tu med pa'i 'khor bas yongs su skyo ba med pa'o //

translated: This is the bodhisattva great beings’

analyzed: bslab pa thams cad la sgyu med pa gang yin pa ste /

analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i bslab pa yongs su mi gtong ba'o //

analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i 'dod pa'i yon tan la smod pa gang zhe na /

analyzed: 'dod pa'i sems mi bskyed pa gang yin pa ste /

analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i 'dod pa'i yon tan la smod pa'o //

analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i mya ngan las 'das pa dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pa gang zhe na /

analyzed: 'di ltar chos thams cad mngon par 'du byed pa med pa gang yin pa ste /

analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i mya ngan las 'das pa dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pa'o //
translated: This is the bodhisattva-mahāsattva’s mind that is directed toward nirvāṇa.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i rdzas thams cad yongs su gtong ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i rdzas thams cad yongs su gtong ba gang zhe na /
translated: “What, you should ask, is the bodhisattva-mahāsattva’s giving away of all possessions?

original: phyi nang gi chos @242b thams cad la 'dzin pa med pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: phyi nang gi chos @242b thams cad la 'dzin pa med pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: It is the non-grasping at all inner and outer phenomena.

analyzed: 'di na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i rdzas thams cad yongs su gtong ba'o //
translated: This is the bodhisattva-mahāsattva’s giving away of all possessions.

analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sems zhum pa med pa gang zhe na /

analyzed: rnam par shes pa gnas pa la de'i sems mi gnas pa gang yin pa ste /

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sems zhum pa med pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sems zhum pa med pa'o //
translated: This is the bodhisattvas’ and great spiritual heroes’ absence of mental weariness.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i dngos po thams cad la ltos pa med pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i dngos po thams cad la ltos pa med pa gang zhe na /

original: dngos po thams cad yid la mi byed pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: dngos po thams cad yid la mi byed pa gang yin pa ste /

analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i dngos po thams cad la ltos pa med pa'o //
translated: This is the bodhisattvas’ and great spiritual heroes’ absence of concern for all things.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i khyim pa dang bsten pa yongs su spang pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i khyim pa dang bsten pa yongs su spang pa gang zhe na /

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows.

analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing du 'gro zhing rdzus te skye ba dang / mgo bregs shing dur smrig gi gos bgo ba gang yin pa ste /

analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i khyim pa dang bsten pa yongs su spang pa'o //
translated: This is the bodhisattva-mahāsattva’s avoidance of associating with householders.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i dge slong ma dang bsten pa yongs su spang ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i dge slong ma dang bsten pa yongs su spang ba gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the bodhisattva-mahāsattva’s avoidance of associating with bhikṣuṇīs?

analyzed: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos rtag par 'dzin par mi bya'o //
translated: In this way, the bodhisattva mahāsattva should not grasp at permanence.

original: de la ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos mtshan ma'i 'du shes su mi bya zhe na /
analyzed: de la ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos mtshan ma'i 'du shes su mi bya zhe na /
translated: “What, you may wonder, does the bodhisattva mahāsattva not grasp at as a sign?

original: de ni 'di ltar kun nas nyon mongs pa shin tu med pa'i phyir te /🔽de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos mtshan ma'i 'du shes su mi bya'o //
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar kun nas nyon mongs pa shin tu med pa'i phyir te / de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos mtshan ma'i 'du shes su mi bya'o //
translated: It is as follows: because there is no affliction at all.🔽In this way, the bodhisattva mahāsattva should not grasp at signs.

original: de la ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos rgyur lta bar mi bya zhe na /
analyzed: de la ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos rgyur lta bar mi bya zhe na /
translated: “What, you may wonder, does the bodhisattva mahāsattva not grasp at as a cause?

original: de ni 'di ltar lta ba de yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar lta ba de yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because they do not see that view as real.

original: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos rgyur lta bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos rgyur lta bar mi bya'o //
translated: Thus should the bodhisattva great beings not view causes.

original: de la ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos phung po dang / skye mched dang / khams la mngon par chags par mi bya zhe na /
analyzed: de la ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos phung po dang / skye mched dang / khams la mngon par chags par mi bya zhe na /
translated: “How should the bodhisattva great beings not become attached to the aggregates, elements, and sense-sources?

original: de ni 'di ltar chos de dag shin tu med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar chos de dag shin tu med pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because those phenomena are utterly nonexistent.

original: de ltar phung po dang / skye mched dang / khams la mngon par chags par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar phung po dang / skye mched dang / khams la mngon par chags par mi bya'o //
translated: Thus should they not become attached to the aggregates, elements, and sense-sources.

original: de la ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos khams gsum la mngon par chags par mi bya zhe na /
analyzed: de la ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos khams gsum la mngon par chags par mi bya zhe na /
translated: “How should the bodhisattva great beings not become attached to the three realms?

original: de ni 'di ltar de'i rang bzhin med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar de'i rang bzhin med pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because they are without intrinsic nature.

original: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos khams gsum la mngon par chags par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos khams gsum la mngon par chags par mi bya'o //
translated: Thus should the bodhisattva great beings not become attached to the three realms.

original: de la ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos khams gsum la mngon par zhen par mi bya zhe na /
analyzed: de la ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos khams gsum la mngon par zhen par mi bya zhe na /
translated: “What, you may wonder, does the bodhisattva’s non-fixation on the three realms consist in?

original: de ni 'di ltar de'i dngos po med cing mi dmigs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar de'i dngos po med cing mi dmigs pa'i phyir /
translated: It is the non-fixation on the three realms that is due to the non-apprehension of the three realms.

original: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos khams gsum la mngon par zhen par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos khams gsum la mngon par zhen par mi bya'o //
translated: Thus, bodhisattvas do not fixate on the three realms.

original: de la ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos khams gsum la brten pa dang gnas par mi bya zhe na /
analyzed: de la ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos khams gsum la brten pa dang gnas par mi bya zhe na /
translated: “What, you may wonder, does the bodhisattvas’ non-reliance on the three realms consist in?

original: de na 'di ltar de'i dngos po med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de na 'di ltar de'i dngos po med pa'i phyir te /
translated: It is the non-reliance on the three realms that is due to the non-apprehension of the three realms.

original: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos khams gsum la brten pa dang gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos khams gsum la brten pa dang gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: Thus, bodhisattvas do not rely on the three realms.

original: de la ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sangs rgyas la brten pa'i lta ba la mngon par chags par mi bya zhe na /
analyzed: de la ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sangs rgyas la brten pa'i lta ba la mngon par chags par mi bya zhe na /
translated: “What, you may wonder, does the bodhisattvas’ non-fixation on the view of reliance on the Buddha consist in?

original: de ni 'di ltar sangs rgyas su lta ba la brten nas /
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar sangs rgyas su lta ba la brten nas /
translated: It is the non-fixation on the view of reliance on the Buddha that is due to the non-apprehension of the view of reliance on the Buddha.

original: @245a * // sangs rgyas su mthong bar mi 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: @245a * // sangs rgyas su mthong bar mi 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because one does not see the Buddha.

original: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sangs rgyas la brten pa'i lta ba la mngon par chags par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sangs rgyas la brten pa'i lta ba la mngon par chags par mi bya'o //
translated: Thus, the bodhisattva-mahāsattva should not become attached to the view of relying on the Buddha.

original: de la ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos chos la brten pa'i lta ba la mngon par chags par mi bya zhe na /
analyzed: de la ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos chos la brten pa'i lta ba la mngon par chags par mi bya zhe na /
translated: How, you should ask, should the bodhisattva-mahāsattva not become attached to the view of relying on the Dharma?

original: de ni 'di ltar chos su lta ba la brten pas chos mthong bar mi 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar chos su lta ba la brten pas chos mthong bar mi 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because, by relying on the view of the Dharma, one does not see the Dharma.

original: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos chos la brten pa'i lta ba la mngon par chags par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos chos la brten pa'i lta ba la mngon par chags par mi bya'o //
translated: Thus, the bodhisattva-mahāsattva should not become attached to the view of relying on the Dharma.

original: de la ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos dge 'dun la brten pa'i lta ba la mngon par chags par mi bya zhe na /
analyzed: de la ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos dge 'dun la brten pa'i lta ba la mngon par chags par mi bya zhe na /
translated: How, you should ask, should the bodhisattva-mahāsattva not become attached to the view of relying on the Saṅgha?

original: de ni 'di ltar dge 'dun du lta ba la brten pas dge 'dun mthong bar mi 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar dge 'dun du lta ba la brten pas dge 'dun mthong bar mi 'gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: Because, in this way, one does not see the Saṅgha by relying on the view of the Saṅgha.

original: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos dge 'dun la brten pa'i lta ba la mngon par chags par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos dge 'dun la brten pa'i lta ba la mngon par chags par mi bya'o //
translated: Thus, the bodhisattva-mahāsattva should not become attached to the view of relying on the Saṅgha.

original: de la ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos tshul khrims la brten pa'i lta ba la mngon par chags par mi bya zhe na /
analyzed: de la ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos tshul khrims la brten pa'i lta ba la mngon par chags par mi bya zhe na /
translated: “Among those, how should the bodhisattva-mahāsattva not become attached to the view of relying on morality?

original: de ni 'di ltar tshul khrims su lta ba la brten pa'i tshul khrims rnam par dag par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar tshul khrims su lta ba la brten pa'i tshul khrims rnam par dag par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because, in this way, the purity of morality does not arise by relying on the view of morality.

original: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos tshul khrims la brten pa'i lta ba la mngon par chags par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos tshul khrims la brten pa'i lta ba la mngon par chags par mi bya'o //
translated: Thus, the bodhisattva-mahāsattva should not become attached to the view of relying on morality.

original: de la ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos chos rnams stong ngo zhes zhum par mi bya zhe na /
analyzed: de la ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos chos rnams stong ngo zhes zhum par mi bya zhe na /
translated: “Among those, how should the bodhisattva-mahāsattva not become disheartened by thinking, ‘The dharmas are empty’?

original: de ni 'di ltar chos thams cad stong pa nyid kyis stong pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar chos thams cad stong pa nyid kyis stong pa ma yin gyi /
translated: It is not that all dharmas are empty because of emptiness,

original: rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa'i phyir te /
translated: but because they are empty of their own marks.

original: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos chos rnams stong ngo zhes zhum par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos chos rnams stong ngo zhes zhum par mi bya'o //
translated: Thus should the Bodhisattva, the great being, not be depressed when all dharmas are empty.

original: de la ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos stong pa nyid dang 'gal bar mi bya zhe na /
analyzed: de la ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos stong pa nyid dang 'gal bar mi bya zhe na /
translated: How should the Bodhisattva, the great being, not contradict emptiness?

original: de ni 'di ltar chos thams cad stong pas stong pa nyid dang 'gal bar mi byed pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar chos thams cad stong pas stong pa nyid dang 'gal bar mi byed pa'i phyir te /
translated: It is not that all dharmas are empty because of emptiness, but because they are empty of their own marks.

original: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos stong pa nyid dang 'gal bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos stong pa nyid dang 'gal bar mi bya'o //
translated: Thus should the Bodhisattva, the great being, not contradict emptiness.

original: de la ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos stong pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par bya ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: de la ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos stong pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par bya ba yin zhe na /
translated: How should the Bodhisattva, the great being, perfect emptiness?

original: rang gi mtshan nyid stong @245b pa nyid nye bar bzung nas yongs su rdzogs pa ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i stong pa nyid yongs su rdzogs pa ste /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid stong @245b pa nyid nye bar bzung nas yongs su rdzogs pa ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i stong pa nyid yongs su rdzogs pa ste /
translated: Taking up the emptiness of defining characteristics is the completion of the perfection of emptiness of bodhisattva great beings.

original: de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i stong pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i stong pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'o //
translated: This is the bodhisattva great beings’ completion of the perfection of emptiness.

original: de la ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos mtshan ma med pa mngon du bya ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: de la ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos mtshan ma med pa mngon du bya ba yin zhe na /
translated: “What, you may wonder, does the bodhisattva great beings’ realization of signlessness consist in?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows.

original: mtshan ma thams cad yid la mi byed pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: mtshan ma thams cad yid la mi byed pa'i phyir te /
translated: It is the non-attention to all signs.

original: de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i mtshan ma med pa mngon du bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i mtshan ma med pa mngon du bya ba'o //
translated: This is the bodhisattva great beings’ realization of signlessness.

original: de la ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i smon pa med pa shes pa zhe na /
analyzed: de la ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i smon pa med pa shes pa zhe na /
translated: “What, you may wonder, does the bodhisattva great beings’ knowledge of wishlessness consist in?

original: de ni khams gsum thams cad du sems mi gnas pa ste /
analyzed: de ni khams gsum thams cad du sems mi gnas pa ste /
translated: It is the mind not abiding in any of the three realms.

original: de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i smon pa med pa shes pa'o //
analyzed: de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i smon pa med pa shes pa'o //
translated: This is the bodhisattva-mahāsattva’s knowledge of wishlessness.

original: de la ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: de la ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa yin zhe na /
translated: “What, you may wonder, does the bodhisattva-mahāsattva’s purification of the three spheres consist in?

original: dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam yongs su rdzogs pa ste /
analyzed: dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam yongs su rdzogs pa ste /
translated: It is the completion of the path of the ten virtuous actions.

original: de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa'o //
analyzed: de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa'o //
translated: This is the bodhisattva-mahāsattva’s purification of the three spheres.

original: de la ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sems can thams cad la snying rje zhing snying brtse ba yongs su rdzogs pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: de la ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sems can thams cad la snying rje zhing snying brtse ba yongs su rdzogs pa yin zhe na /
translated: “What, you may wonder, does the bodhisattva-mahāsattva’s completion of compassion and love for all beings consist in?

original: snying rje chen po thob pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: snying rje chen po thob pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: It is the attainment of great compassion.

original: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sems can thams cad la snying rje zhing snying brtse ba yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sems can thams cad la snying rje zhing snying brtse ba yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'o //
translated: In this way, the bodhisattva-mahāsattva completes his compassion and love for all beings.

original: de la ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sems can thams cad la brnyas par mi bya zhe na /
analyzed: de la ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sems can thams cad la brnyas par mi bya zhe na /
translated: “What is the bodhisattva-mahāsattva’s not despising any sentient being?”

original: byams pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: byams pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir te /
translated: It is the complete perfection of love.

original: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sems can thams cad la brnyas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sems can thams cad la brnyas par mi bya'o //
translated: Thus, the bodhisattva-mahāsattva does not despise any sentient being.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid du lta ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid du lta ba gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the bodhisattva-mahāsattva’s view of the sameness of all phenomena?”

original: chos thams cad la bsnan pa dang dbri ba med pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad la bsnan pa dang dbri ba med pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: It is the absence of addition or subtraction in all phenomena.

original: de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos chos thams cad la mnyam pa nyid du lta ba'o //
analyzed: de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos chos thams cad la mnyam pa nyid du lta ba'o //
translated: That is the bodhisattva-mahāsattva’s view of the sameness of all phenomena.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i yang dag pa'i tshul rab tu rdzogs pa gang zhe na /🔽chos thams cad tshul gcig tu rtogs kyang rtogs pa @246a * //
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i yang dag pa'i tshul rab tu rdzogs pa gang zhe na / chos thams cad tshul gcig tu rtogs kyang rtogs pa @246a * //
translated: “What is the bodhisattva-mahāsattva’s complete perfection of the correct method?”

original: med pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: med pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: It is the realization of all phenomena as a single method without realization.🔽That is the bodhisattva-mahāsattva’s complete perfection of the correct method.

original: de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i yang dag pa'i tshul rab tu rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i yang dag pa'i tshul rab tu rtogs pa'o //
translated: This is the bodhisattva-mahāsattva’s realization of the true principle.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i mi skye ba la bzod pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i mi skye ba la bzod pa gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the bodhisattva-mahāsattva’s acceptance of nonproduction?

original: chos thams cad skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa dang / mngon par 'du bya ba med pa la bzod pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa dang / mngon par 'du bya ba med pa la bzod pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: It is the acceptance that all dharmas are nonproduced, unceasing, and not appropriated.

original: de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i mi skye ba la bzod pa'o //
analyzed: de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i mi skye ba la bzod pa'o //
translated: This is the bodhisattva-mahāsattva’s acceptance of nonproduction.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i mi skye ba shes pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i mi skye ba shes pa gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the bodhisattva-mahāsattva’s knowledge of nonproduction?

original: ming dang gzugs mi skye ba shes pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: ming dang gzugs mi skye ba shes pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: It is the knowledge that name-and-form are nonproduced.

original: de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i mi skye ba shes pa'o //
analyzed: de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i mi skye ba shes pa'o //
translated: This is the bodhisattva-mahāsattva’s knowledge of nonproduction.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i chos thams cad tshul gcig tu bstan pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i chos thams cad tshul gcig tu bstan pa gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the bodhisattva-mahāsattva’s teaching of all dharmas as one principle?

original: gnyis la yongs su rgyu ba med pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: gnyis la yongs su rgyu ba med pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: It is the absence of complete engagement in the two.

original: de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i chos thams cad tshul gcig tu bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i chos thams cad tshul gcig tu bstan pa'o //
translated: This is the bodhisattva great beings’ teaching of all phenomena as one.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i rtog pa yang dag par bsal ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i rtog pa yang dag par bsal ba gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the bodhisattva great beings’ dispelling of conceptualization?

original: chos thams cad la rnam par rtog pa med pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad la rnam par rtog pa med pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: It is the absence of conceptualization about all phenomena.

original: de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i rtog pa yang dag par bsal ba'o //
analyzed: de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i rtog pa yang dag par bsal ba'o //
translated: This is the bodhisattva great beings’ dispelling of conceptualization.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i 'du shes dang / lta ba rnam par bzlog pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i 'du shes dang / lta ba rnam par bzlog pa gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the bodhisattva great beings’ turning away from perceptions and views?

original: nyan thos kyi sa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sa rnam par spong pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi sa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sa rnam par spong pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: It is the avoidance of the śrāvaka level and the pratyekabuddha level.

original: de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i 'du shes dang / lta ba rnam par ldog pa'o//

analyzed: de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sems can thams cad kyi skad shes par bya ba khong du chud pa'o //
